alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 22 at 10:15PM CST until January 27 at 9:16PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Franklin, Titus, Morris and Red River Counties. .An active storm track will lead to several rounds of heavy rainfall through Wednesday night. Rainfall totals around 5 to 7 inches will be possible with locally higher amounts possible. For the Sulphur River...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sulphur River near Talco. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Expect moderate flooding of lowland areas with some secondary roadways closed. All cattle and equipment nearby the river should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CST Monday the stage was 5.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday afternoon to a crest of 24.0 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.1 feet on 04/30/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening at 1015 PM CST.
